pull.title: [Qt] Improve progress display during headers-sync and peer-finding
pull.body: Stumbled over this during some Core-SPV work. After a fresh start (especially if no `peers.dat` file is available), it can take a couple of seconds until we can start syncing. During this time, the user is not directly informed about the current state. Same problem appears when syncing headers. If you download the headers from a slow peer, this can take a couple of minutes. Users can't see the reason why the sync hasn't started. This PR fixes this by displaying the "Connecting to peers..." in the Status-Bar when no peers are available as well as it shows "Syncing Headers (%%)..." during the headers-sync phase and only if the headers-tip is older then 24*600. Screenshots:

events.body: Nit: If you feel like it, you can also fix the documentation for getBlockSource, which wrongly states a *boolean* is returned. https://dev.visucore.com/bitcoin/doxygen/class_client_model.html#acd447f61bfd57267a31a0aa88c176ee6

This is currently tagged for 0.14, but seems not yet ready. (I blame myself for not taking a second look). 

Given that it is mostly only a minor gui change,  I'd prefer to defer this and assign the 0.15 milestone?

Thanks @sipa for the review. Fixed all points.

@MarcoFalke: We could postpone this for 0.15.
This – simple – PR together with the new modal overlay, does guide the user much better during the first startup. Connecting to peers and syncing the first headers can take a couple of seconds... during this stage, I think it would be great to show a minimal progress update.

Let's try to get one or two tested ACK's (or NACKs) today, and, if not, we untag it tomorrow.

events.message: [Qt] Improve progress display during headers-sync and peer-finding

events.body: Thanks for the review @TheBlueMatt. Updated and remove the dead-code part.
I was trying to reproduce the scenario mentioned in the OP, but somehow it shows just right already in current master...
utACK 40ec7c7b0d2a5a37de90635b676b16884b622dd6, would be nice to not use the 600 constant but it doesnt matter too much for now.

comments.body: I think this is dead code, because whenever `getNumConnections()==0`, you display `Connecting ...`. And whenever `getNumConnections()>0`, you are in the case of `BLOCK_SOURCE_NETWORK`.
Please don't hardcode the interblock time 600, but use Consensus::Params::nPowTargetTimespan.
What does the boolean return value indicate? It seems unused.
Where does the value 24 come from? Can you provide a named constant for it?
~~The boolean indicates whether the label was updated or not. This reduces redundant calls in `bitcoingui.cpp`. I'll document it a bit more.~~

Comes from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8821 over modaloverlay.cpp.
I'll try to move this into a constant.
Nevermind. It's no longer in use! I'll fix that.
I believe this is dead code - getBlockSource will always return at least BLOCK_SOURCE_NETWORK if getNumConnections is > 0.
I dont believe this was fixed?
Nit: I know I initially put it there, but please change it to Consensus::Params::nPowTargetSpacing, as sipa requested.
